text:
Created attachment 33188
Example workaround for module

Prior to 2.4.17-dev, it was possible to hook just prior to the default handler in the handlers list by hooking APR_HOOK_REALLY_LAST and specifying "core.c" as a successor.

However, 2.4.17-dev has introduced a second "core.c" handler at the start of the handlers list for protocol handling. This breaks existing behaviour.

The workaround is to hook "almost last", however this is imprecise as other modules (eg mod_dialup) may specify the same precendence.

Suggest this change is documented for module authors?
creator: apache-b6e@deemzed.uk
apache-b6e@deemzed.uk

creator: covener@gmail.com
text:
Thanks for the report.

I don't think there's a good place to capture this (for others to find it) other than here in this bug report. 

Closing with a somewhat bogus value so it doesn't show as an open issue.
